title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO (AP) – On a night where the final score suggests a team victory, the record books will tell a different story. They will tell the story of one man, a singular force of nature who authored a performance for the ages. The Dallas Mavericks escaped Orlando with a 108-102 victory, but this game belonged, from first second to final buzzer, to George McCloud.

McCloud didn’t just play; he conducted a symphony of scoring, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 42 points in a breathtaking display of offensive firepower. The Orlando Magic defense, helpless and hapless, could only watch as McCloud rained down an arsenal of shots. He was a whirlwind, slicing to the rim and stepping back beyond the arc, leaving a trail of frustrated defenders in his wake.

His backcourt mate, Jason Kidd, orchestrated the masterpiece, dishing out 17 assists, many of which found McCloud in perfect rhythm. While Shaquille O’Neal’s Magic battled valiantly, with Shaq himself posting a formidable 29 points and 14 rebounds, they were merely the backdrop to McCloud’s historic night. Every time Orlando threatened to close the gap, McCloud answered with another clutch basket, a silent assassin extinguishing any hope of a home victory.

The final horn sounded on a six-point Mavericks win, but the celebration was for one man. In a league of giants, it was George McCloud who stood tallest, scoring 42 points in a game that will forever be remembered not for the team result, but for a legendary individual outburst that defied expectation and seized the spotlight.
